column5: Anybody use the moss-like stuff that hangs from the half dead spruce trees as fire starter? It burns great even when damp - burns almost like kerosene. The stuff looks a little like spanish moss on a much smaller scale. Anyhow - I wondering what it is called. Is it a moss or lichen or what? anyone know what I am talking about?? thanks, lobo1
We Call it GAS!! Is awesome stuff works when nothing else will. Lights like a dream.

An easy fire starter that's easy to carry and safer than gas is to dip cotton balls in Vaseline pertoleum jelly. You can put about a half a dozen in a plastic medicine bottle and keep in your tackle box. They work great.
It is called arboreal lichen and you're right - it is the BEST fire starter and available anytime and, in our area, anywhere
We ole timers call it goats beard, or squaw whiskers.
Called "Old Man's Beard" around here. A major whitetail & moose food source in winter.
Thanks for the info - goat's beard, reindeer moss, gas, old man's beard.....arboreal lichens - cool!
LOBO, Check out the following web site. Scroll down to "TINDER" There is lots of good info in this site. It covers just about everything outdoors.http://www.oldjimbo.com/survival/ Randy
